english_translation: Biography of Muhammad ibn Abd al-Rahman ibn Abi Layla ibn Bilal ibn Bulayl ibn Ahihah ibn al-Jallah al-Ansari - This entry provides the genealogical chain and identification of a narrator from the Islamic tradition.

narrators.name: Biographical Entry Subject
narrators.full_name: Muhammad ibn Abd al-Rahman ibn Abi Layla ibn Bilal ibn Bulayl ibn Ahihah ibn al-Jallah al-Ansari

chainIssues: This is a biographical entry header only, not a complete hadith transmission
No actual chain of transmission present

IISGrade: Disconnections But All Narrators Are Ok
Topics: Identity of Muhammad ibn Abd al-Rahman ibn Abi Layla

english_translation: From the group of Banu Juhijah ibn Kulfa from Banu Amr ibn Awf from al-Aws - they unanimously agreed that he died in Kufa in the year 148 AH. He had served as judge for the Umayyads, then he served as judge for the Abbasids during the governorship of Isa ibn Musa over Kufa and its territories. Al-Fadl ibn Dukain reported to us, saying: When Muhammad ibn Abd al-Rahman ibn Abi Layla died, he had reached seventy-two years of age.

narrators.name: Al-Fadl ibn Dukain
narrators.full_name: Al-Fadl ibn Dukain ibn Dinar al-Kufi
narrators.alternative_names: Abu Yahya al-Kufi, Fadl ibn Dukain

narrators.name: Muhammad ibn Abd al-Rahman ibn Abi Layla
narrators.full_name: Muhammad ibn Abd al-Rahman ibn Abi Layla ibn Bilal ibn Bulayl al-Ansari

chainIssues: Two transmission terms used: أَخْبَرَنَا (strong) and قَالَ (weaker) indicating indirect connection from Ibn Abi Layla
This is primarily biographical/historical information rather than a hadith transmission
The chain terminates at a tabaqah (generation level) rather than connecting to the Prophet ﷺ or a Companion

potential_issues.impact: While Al-Fadl ibn Dukain uses the direct term 'akhbarana', Ibn Abi Layla's report uses 'qala' which is less direct, though not significantly problematic given both narrators' reliability
This entry is primarily historical biographical information (death date and age) rather than a religious hadith or legal ruling

potential_issues.issue: Chain does not connect to Prophet ﷺ or established Companion
potential_issues.impact: The chain is mawquf (stopped), ending at Ibn Abi Layla's biographical account of his ancestor

Topics: Death of Muhammad ibn Abd al-Rahman ibn Abi Layla

english_translation: Ahmad ibn Abdullah ibn Yunus reported to us, he said: Abu Shihab narrated to us, he said: Ibn Abi Layla reported to us, he said: I do not remember anything from my father's affairs, except that I know he had two wives, and he had two green vessels, he would prepare fermented drink at this one on one day, and at that one on another day.

narrators.name: Ahmad ibn Abdullah ibn Yunus
narrators.full_name: Ahmad ibn Abdullah ibn Yunus al-Amarri al-Kufi

narrators.name: Abu Shihab
narrators.full_name: Abu Shihab al-Hasani (likely Muhammad ibn Uthman)

narrators.name: Ibn Abi Layla
narrators.full_name: Muhammad ibn Abd al-Rahman ibn Abi Layla ibn Bilal al-Ansari
narrators.alternative_names: Muhammad ibn Abd al-Rahman, Abu Muhammad

narrators.name: His father (father of the speaker)
narrators.transmissionTermMeaning: He said (the speaker indicates he is reporting about his father)

chainIssues: Multiple transmission terms used: أَخْبَرَنَا, حَدَّثَنَا, أَخْبَرَنَا - all direct terms indicating strong connections
The content is personal biographical memory of family practices rather than a formal hadith transmission
No clear connection to the Prophet ﷺ or Companions - this is a personal family practice account

potential_issues.issue: Personal memory rather than formal hadith transmission
potential_issues.impact: The speaker explicitly states 'I do not remember anything from my father's affairs except...' indicating incomplete memory and personal account rather than authenticated transmission

potential_issues.issue: Biographical/personal practice rather than religious ruling
potential_issues.impact: The account describes personal domestic practices (wives and fermentation vessels) without clear religious or legal significance
The chain does not connect to the Prophet ﷺ or a Companion, terminating at personal family accounts of the fourth generation

potential_issues.issue: All narrators at Saduq/acceptable level, not highest reliability
potential_issues.impact: While all narrators are acceptable, none reach the level of Thiqah Thabt or Thabt Hujjah, which slightly affects overall reliability

Topics: Domestic Practices of Early Islamic Period

english_translation: He was a slave for them, he was a carpenter, his residence was in al-Nakh', his house was opposite the mosque of Hafs ibn Ghiyath, he died at the beginning of the caliphate of Abu Ja'far, and he was weak in hadith.

narrators.name: Unknown narrator (subject of biographical entry)
narrators.death_year: Early caliphate of Abu Ja'far (~133-136 AH)

chainIssues: No transmission chain provided - biographical entry only
Narrator explicitly graded as weak in hadith (ضعيف في حديثه)
The entry provides only biographical information, not actual hadith content

potential_issues.issue: Narrator explicitly graded as weak in hadith
potential_issues.impact: The source explicitly states this narrator was 'weak in hadith' (ضعيف في حديثه), indicating unreliability in transmission

potential_issues.issue: No transmission chain or hadith content
potential_issues.impact: This is purely biographical information with no actual hadith transmission to authenticate

english_translation: Muhammad ibn al-Sa'ib al-Kalbi ibn Bishr ibn Amr ibn al-Harith ibn Abd al-Harith ibn Abd al-Uzza ibn Imru al-Qays ibn Amir ibn al-Nu'man ibn Amir ibn Abd Wud ibn Kanana ibn Awf ibn Udhrah ibn Zayd al-Lat ibn Rifadah ibn Thur ibn Kalb

narrators.name: Muhammad ibn al-Sa'ib al-Kalbi
narrators.full_name: Muhammad ibn al-Sa'ib al-Kalbi ibn Bishr ibn Amr ibn al-Harith ibn Abd al-Harith ibn Abd al-Uzza ibn Imru al-Qays ibn Amir ibn al-Nu'man ibn Amir ibn Abd Wud ibn Kanana ibn Awf ibn Udhrah ibn Zayd al-Lat ibn Rifadah ibn Thur ibn Kalb
reliabilityIssues: Known as a mudallis who would hide the weakness of narrators above him
Extensively criticized for inaccuracy in genealogies and traditions
narrators.alternative_names: Abu al-Nadhr al-Kalbi, Muhammad ibn al-Sa'ib

chainIssues: This is a genealogical entry only, containing no transmission chain or hadith content
The subject (al-Kalbi) is known for fabrication and unreliability in hadith transmission

potential_issues.impact: Muhammad ibn al-Sa'ib al-Kalbi is widely known among hadith scholars as a weak narrator prone to fabrication and errors in genealogies and traditions

potential_issues.issue: No transmission chain or hadith content
potential_issues.impact: This entry contains only genealogical information with no actual hadith transmission to analyze or authenticate
Al-Kalbi's genealogies are known to be unreliable, so even the genealogical information presented here should be treated with caution
